translated: The Mansion on the Plane of the Gods🔽The Divine Maiden’s Mansion
The Chapter about Cittalatā
The Divine Maiden’s Mansion of Bhaddā🔽“Blue, yellow, and black,
Vermilion, and red,🔽A variety of colors,
Surrounded by a halo.
A garland of coral jasmine flowers

analyzed: kiñjakkha parivāritā  mandāravānam pupphāna  mālam dhāresi muddhani
translated: You wear on your head.
These are not found on other bodies,
Trees for one of great wisdom.
In whose body were you reborn,🔽Resplendent among the Thirty-Three?
Goddess, please tell me this,
What is the fruit of this deed?”
“They called me Bhaddā,
The laywoman Kimilā;
I had faith and was endowed with virtue,
And I always delighted in sharing.🔽Clothing, food,
A dwelling, and a lamp,
I gave to those who were upright
With a serene mind.
On the fourteenth, fifteenth,
And eighth of the fortnight,
And on the day of the full moon,
I observed the eight-factored observance.🔽I always observed the observance,
Restrained in the precepts,
Self-controlled and sharing,
I dwell in a divine mansion.
Abstaining from killing living creatures,

original: musāvādā ca saññatā;🔽Theyyā ca aticārā ca,
analyzed: musāvādā ca saññatā  theyyā ca aticārā ca
translated: and restrained from false speech,🔽from theft and from misconduct in sensual pleasures,
and from liquor, wine, and besotting drink.
Delighting in the five training rules,
skilled in the noble truths,🔽a lay follower of the Buddha,
living heedfully,
having lived the spiritual life, having done good deeds, after passing away
I wander by my own radiance in the Nandana grove.

analyzed: bhikkhū ca aham parama hita anukampake
translated: I supported the monks, the supremely compassionate,
the great sage, the pair of seers;

original: Katāvāsā katakusalā tato cutā,🔽Sayaṁpabhā anuvicarāmi nandanaṁ.
analyzed: kata āvāsā kata kusalā  anuvicarāmi nandana
translated: having lived the spiritual life, having done good deeds, after passing away🔽I wander by my own radiance in the Nandana grove.🔽The eight-factored, immeasurable, happiness-bringing

analyzed: aṭṭhaṅgikam aparimitam sukha āvaha  uposatham satatam upa avasim aha
translated: Uposatha I always observed;
having lived the spiritual life, having done good deeds, after passing away
I wander by my own radiance in the Nandana grove.”
The Fifth Mansion
